channel.title: My server
channel.description:
Well I have this server that I run on my pc, it is a dedi but it's like those advanced shits like with low lag and stuff.
[IMG]http://i175.photobucket.com/albums/w160/albanian4life_2007/iui.jpg[/img]
Is it possible for me to get a control panel on a free domain like freewebs [theres better that i can actually run it on] but i have no idea how to code or shit like that. Is it possible? If so do you have any ideas? Thanks in advance. /sorry for grammar

item.title: My server

item.description:

ThAt0n36Uy:

Just use Amxmod it allows you to control the server from within the game by typing commands into the console.

Please re-read the topic. I know about amx but i want a cp for it.

item.title: My server
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

On another topic

I honestly couldn’t understand why anyone would spend hours learning how to set up a Linux server when they can use an OS they’re used to and just waste a tiny bit of processing power.

People don’t use linux to save a ‘tiny bit of processing power’, it’s more stable and simply much much better for a server, hence why most servers on the internet run it.

About this thread, you can use Xampp to run a webserver on your own computer and then have a PHP script run system commands to control it, webmin is a program already written for this purpose, but it probably doesn’t run on windows.

If you were smart, you would install linux and run your server from that.

Read full topic

item.title: My server
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“magma, post:1, topic:232918”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=305386.msg2447391#msg2447391 date=1221793100]
hosting a server on media center? rofl
[/quote]
Yah thats what i do, even my computer is easily fast enough to handle xp, even vista in aero theme, i still like getting that extra bit of fastness.

Classic mode does a lot, with a plain blue wallpaper and barely any icons on desktop/quick launch == fast.

I got a new server yesterday and installed xp because i was too retarded to learn how to use ubuntu server. It has 192MB of RAM and a single core 2.80GHz Intel CPU.

I simply stop any unneeded programs running on startup, set it to the classic theme and leave it. It boots in literally 20 seconds (10 seconds passing BIOS screens). Any Linux distro is going to take this amount of time to boot, and my server isn’t exactly running slow with its shitty memory. I honestly couldn’t understand why anyone would spend hours learning how to set up a Linux server when they can use an OS they’re used to and just waste a tiny bit of processing power.[/quote]

Read full topic
